snippet: Little fingers can seed tomatoes and pick herbs off stems, but children may not like to eat the vegetables they just prepared.
abstract: Elaine Louie Sprouts column notes that children don’t necessarily like to eat vegetables and their parents, especially if they are chefs, appreciate not just the healthfulness of vegetables but also their extraordinary range of flavors and possibilities; suggests that parents don’t try to sneak in the vegetables, instead, make simple tasty dishes that showcase the produce.
lead_paragraph: Little fingers can seed tomatoes and pick herbs off stems, but children may not like to eat the vegetables they just prepared.

headline.seo: Chefs, Restaurateurs and Cookbook Authors Cook Vegetables With Their Children
